thread.title: Police Investigate Political Sign Thefts in Stratford
thread.title_full: Police Investigate Political Sign Thefts in Stratford

title: Police Investigate Political Sign Thefts in Stratford
text: Stratford Police Police are investigating the thefts of political signs in Stratford. Someone is stealing political signs in Stratford and police have released surveillance photos as they try to determine who is responsible. Police received a complaint on Thursday that three political signs that had been in front of the Vitamin Shack at 1615 Main Street had been stolen. These are just the latest in a series of thefts of “Vote Yes” signs, as well as “Rich Fredette for Zoning” and “Barnaby for Council” signs. The signs were taken at 3:36 a.m., despite the surveillance video timestamp, which is about an hour behind, The video shows a person in shorts, white socks and work boots removing the signs and placing them into a car. Police ask anyone with information about the person in the photos to call Detective Michael Panton at (203) 385-4143, the Stratford Police Anonymous Tips line (203) 375-8477(TIPS) or the Stratford Police Anonymous Tips IWatch app .
